rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements package

Submodules

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.absence module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.absence.AbsenceSimulationRequirementNode(timeout: float = inf)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

An absence simulation requirement node ensures that no ROS message was received that satisfies a given condition.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

An absence simulation requirement is considered satisfied only if no children simulation requirements is satisfied.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if no children simulation requirement is satisfied. False otherwise.

handle_children_status_change() → None[source]

Handle STATUS_CHANGE commands sent by children nodes. Whenever a child changes state a disjoint requirement node must check its satisfability.

handle_downstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming downstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received dowstream command.

handle_rosbridge_connection_commands(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle commands of type ROSBRIDGE_CONNECT. Forward command to all children nodes and initialize timer thread.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received command.

handle_rosbridge_disconnection_commands(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle commands of type ROSBRIDGE_DISCONNECT. Forwars command to all children nodes and stop timer threads.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received command.

handle_timeout() → None[source]

Handle timeout events. Issue children nodes to stop listening for ROS messages.

handle_upstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming upstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received upstream command.

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.disjoint module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.disjoint.DisjointSimulationRequirementNode[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A disjoint simulation requirement node consists of a node with at least one child.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

A disjoint simulation requirement is considered satisfied only when at least one of its children simulation requirements is also satisfied.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if this simulation requirement is satisfied. False otherwise.

handle_children_status_change() → None[source]

Handle STATUS_CHANGE commands sent by children nodes. Whenever a child changes state a disjoint requirement node must check its satisfability.

handle_downstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming downstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received dowstream command.

handle_trigger(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle TRIGGER command sent by father node.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received upstream command.

handle_upstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming upstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received upstream command.

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.existence module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.existence.ExistenceSimulationRequirementNode(timeout: float = inf)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

An existence simulation requirement node ensures that at least a ROS message was received that satisfies a given condition.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

An existence simulation requirement is considered satisfied only if all children simulation requirements are also satisfied.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if all children simulation requirements are satisfied. False otherwise.

handle_children_status_change() → None[source]

Handle STATUS_CHANGE commands sent by children nodes. Whenever a child changes state a disjoint requirement node must check its satisfability.

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.manager module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.manager.SimulationRequirementsManager(max_timeout: float, min_timeout: float = 0.0)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A simulation requirements manager is responsible for controling all different node trees associated with a given simulation.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

Tell whether or not all simulation requirements were satisfied.

Returns:

True if all simulation requirements were satisfied. False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

connect_to_rosbridge(rosbridge_client: ROSBridgeClient) → None[source]

Issues children nodes to start listening for incoming ROS messages.

Parameters:

rosbridge_client (ROSBridgeClient) – The ROS bridge client.

disconnect_from_rosbridge() → None[source]

Issue children nodes to stop listening for incoming ROS messages.

handle_children_status_change() → None[source]

Handle STATUS_CHANGE commands sent by children nodes. Whenever a child changes state a requirement node must check its satisfability.

handle_start_timeout() → None[source]

Allow simulation to be assessed.

handle_stop_simulation() → None[source]

Handle STOP_SIMULATON commands sent by children nodes. Stops simulation and signals its ending.

handle_stop_timeout() → None[source]
handle_upstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming upstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received upstream command.

stop_simulation() → None[source]

Stop simulation.

stop_timers() → None[source]

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.node module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.node.SimulationRequirementNode[source]

Bases: CommandHandler

Simulation requirements are hierarchical. This class serves as a base class for all simulation requirements tree nodes and declares the interface that they must comply with.

satisfied: bool = False

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.prevention module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.prevention.PreventionSimulationRequirementNode(timeout: float = inf)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A response simulation requirement node ensures that if a ROS message is received that satisfies anterior requirements then no other message ROS message is received that satisfies posterior requirements.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

An existence simulation requirement is considered satisfied only if the posterior requirement is never satisfied after the anterior requirement.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if requirement is satisfied. False otherwise.

children: List[CommandHandler]
father: CommandHandler | None

handle_rosbridge_disconnection_commands(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle timeout events. Issue children nodes to stop listening for ROS messages.

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.requirement module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.requirement.RequirementSimulationRequirementNode(timeout: float = inf)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A response simulation requirement node ensures that if a ROS message is received that satisfies anterior requirements then all posterior requirements were already previously satisfied.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

A response simulation requirement consists is considered satisfied in any of the following situations: - both anterior and posterior requirements are satisfied

children: List[CommandHandler]
father: CommandHandler | None

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.response module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.response.ResponseSimulationRequirementNode(timeout: float = inf)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A response simulation requirement node ensures that no ROS message is received that satisfies posterior requirements before anterior requirements were previously satisfied.

assess_children_nodes() → bool[source]

A response simulation requirement is considered satisfied only if the posterior requirement is satisfied after the anterior requirement.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True is requirement is satisfied. False otherwise.

children: List[CommandHandler]
father: CommandHandler | None
handle_children_status_change() → None[source]

Handle STATUS_CHANGE commands sent by children nodes. Whenever a child changes state a disjoint requirement node must check its satisfability.

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming downstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received dowstream command.

handle_rosbridge_connection_commands(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle commands of type ROSBRIDGE_CONNECT. Forward command to all children nodes and initialize timer thread.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received command.

handle_rosbridge_disconnection_commands(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle commands of type ROSBRIDGE_DISCONNECT. Forwars command to all children nodes and stop timer threads.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received command.

handle_timeout() → None[source]

Handle timeout events. Issue children nodes to stop listening for ROS messages.

handle_trigger(command: Command) → None[source]

Handle commands of type TRIGGER. Forward command to anterior children.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received command.

rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.simple module

class rigel.plugins.core.test.introspection.requirements.simple.SimpleSimulationRequirementNode(ros_topic: str, ros_message_type: str, ros_message_callback: Callable, predicate: str)[source]

Bases: SimulationRequirementNode

A simple simulation requirement node consists of a node without children. Simple simulation requirements interface with ROS bridge clients and hande incoming ROS messages.

children: List[CommandHandler]
connect_to_rosbridge(rosbridge_client: ROSBridgeClient) → None[source]

Register ROS message handler and start listening for incoming ROS messages.

Parameters:

rosbridge_client (ROSBridgeClient) – The ROS bridge client.

disconnect_from_rosbridge() → None[source]

Unregister ROS message handler and stop listening for incoming ROS messages.

father: CommandHandler | None
handle_downstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]

Generic command handler. Forwards incoming downstream commands to their proper handler.

Parameters:

command (Command) – Received downstream command.

handle_trigger(timestamp: float) → None[source]
Parameters:

timestamp (float) – Maximum timestamp for last message received.

handle_upstream_command(command: Command) → None[source]
message_handler(message: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]

ROS message handler. Applied predicate condition to all messages in order to assess simulation requirement.

Parameters:

message (ROS_MESSAGE_TYPE) – The received ROS message.
